Modules¶

Main¶

Script that runs the pypasswordmanager application.

Imports¶

login: import login functions.

ops: import manager operations.

Global variables¶

main.user: string¶

Stores username for the session.

main.master_password: string¶

Stores master password for the session.

main.user_salt: bytes¶

Stores the user’s salt for the session’s cryptographic operations.

main.decrypted_passwords: list of bytes¶

Stores the user’s decrypted passwords for the session’s display.

main.service_password: string¶

Stores new password to be encrypted.

Login¶

Module containing the login functions.

Imports¶

os: for salt generation (os.urandom) and path functions.

Functions¶

input_user(): receives which user the session is for.

is_new_user(): check for a new user.

write_new_user(): write new user and salt to disk.

get_user_salt(): get user’s salt from disk.

login.create_master_password()¶

Receive input of a new master password for the session.

Uses a while loop to ensure the user creates a password at least 8 characters long, then returns the password for use in the session.

Returns

the new master password.

Return type

string

login.get_user_salt(user)¶

Retrieve user’s salt from file in binary mode.

login.input_user()¶

Receive input for username.

Receives input from user to determine username for the session. Contains a loop executed while the username is not at least 4 characters long. Returns username.

Returns

the username for the session.

Return type

string

login.is_new_user(user)¶

Check if username belongs to existing user or not.

Reads the users file and checks if the username is in it.

Returns

if the username is new or not.

Return type

bool

login.write_new_user(user)¶

Write new user information to disk.

Generates random salt using os library, opens users file in binary mode and writes salt and username as a pair. Then, creates file for user passwords in password folder.

Parameters

user (string) – username.

Variables

salt – user’s salt.

Crypto¶

Cryptography module for pypasswordmanager.

Imports¶

base64: for safer encoding of master key during program runs.

Fernet: for encryption and decryption of passwords.

hashes: for access to hashing functions.

PBKDF2HMAC: for generating a master key.

Functions¶

generate_master_key(): for generating a master key from a master password.

fernet_encrypt(): for encrypting a password.

fernet_decrypt(): for decrypting a password.

crypto.fernet_decrypt(token, master_password, salt)¶

Uses Fernet object to decrypt a password.

crypto.fernet_encrypt(password, master_password, salt)¶

Uses Fernet object to encrypt a password

crypto.generate_master_key(master_password, salt)¶

Generate a master key to be temporarily used by other functions.

Instantiates a PBKDF2HMAC object using secure hash function SHA256 and 48000 iterations of the algorithm, then encodes master password to UTF-8 so it is bytes-like, generates the key, encodes it to url-safe format using base64.urlsafe_b64encode and returns it.

Returns

safe master key to be used in encryption and decryption.

Return type

bytes

Ops¶

Operations module for pypasswordmanager application.

Imports¶

os: for path functions.

crypto: for custom cryptographic functions.

Functions¶

input_new_password(): receives new password from the user.

write_new_password(): write new password to disk.

read_passwords(): get list of decrypted passwords.

display_passwords(): display the decrypted passwords.

delete_password(): delete password from disk.

ops.delete_password(user, service, decrypted_passwords)¶

Delete chosen password from disk file.

Iterates through list of decrypted passwords, grab the index of service chosen by the user, then opens password file and, using the readlines() method, stores the passwords in a variable. Then, erases the password by using its index and replacing it with an empty byte and, finally, write the new lines to file using writelines() method.

Parameters

  • user (string) – username.

  • service (string) – service’s name for the password to be erased.

  • decrypted_passwords (list of bytes) – decrypted passwords list.

ops.display_passwords(decrypted_passwords)¶

Display decrypted passwords on screen.

Iterates through the decrypted passwords list, converting the items to strings and adjusting them to look nice.

Parameters

decrypted_passwords (list of bytes) – list containing decrypted passwords.

ops.input_new_password()¶

Receive input for a new service-password pair.

Receives input of the new service, then uses a while loop to confirm the password of said service, then returns them as a pair with “:” in the middle.

Returns

new service-password pair.

Return type

string

ops.read_passwords(user, master_password, salt)¶

Read encrypted passwords from disk and return them decrypted.

Opens user’s passwords file in read-binary mode, transforms the lines into a list, iterates through it and decrypts the passwords one by one using fernet_decrypt() from crypto. Then, returns the list of decrypted passwords.

Parameters

  • user (string) – username.

  • master_password (string) – master password to be used in decryption.

  • salt (bytes) – user’s salt.

Returns

the list of decrypted passwords.

Return type

list of bytes

ops.write_new_password(user, service_password, master_password, salt)¶

Write new encrypted service-password pair to disk.

Encodes the service-password pair to UTF-8 so it can be encrypted, then encrypts it using fernet_encrypt() from crypto and finally writes the encrypted password to the user’s password file.

Parameters

  • user (string) – username.

  • service_password (string) – service-password pair to be encrypted.

  • master_password (string) – master password to be used in encryption.

  • salt (bytes) – user’s salt.
